commit_message:
Remove api-paste.ini as it provided by package

Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no
need to have a template resource for it.  Until we need to
have some attribute, removing this will take away burden of
keeping in sync with base openstack code.

Change-Id: I8ebf93a04916789afc8125303e372ed285b0d799
Related-Bug: #1433152

commit_message:
Enable delta-driven datasources

Ensure that datasources capable of publishing deltas for their data
can send those deltas to Congress, instead of having Congress pull
an entire snapshot of their full data periodically.

Change-Id: Ia48a8a0020a0469e6d781922916af8266a1b7d3c

commit_message:
Treat all negative quota values as -1

Currently if the quota_port, quota_network, quota_subnet values
in the neutron.conf are set to a negative value not equal to -1,
neutron reports the values as is to consumers like Nova.
Nova treats -1 as the infinite quota indicator and doesn't expect
neutron to return any other non-negative value.

The fix allows the flexibility of having any negative number for the
quota parameters in the neutron.conf file and allows the nova boot
to succeed subsequently. The fix would report any negative value
as -1 for port, subnet and network.

Change-Id: Ib9a7136b0bfd01bdf04a5d0937854590029b1010
Closes-Bug: 1438738
Co-Authored-By: Salvatore Orlando <salv.orlando@gmail.com>

* Reduce dead_retry from 300 to 30. When 3 servers lost memcached server
  and detect it differently so the divergence of hash function is 5
  minutes.
* Decrease socket_timeout from 3 seconds to 1 second to detect lost backend
  faster
* Increase pool size from 100 to 1000 connections.

Closes-Bug: 1432242

Change-Id: Ib16a9cba4de8442afa2b78770cb93f561b0fd37e

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tune keystone settings to fail-over faster

* Reduce dead_retry from 300 to 30. When 3 servers lost memcached server
  and detect it differently so the divergence of hash function is 5
  minutes.
* Decrease socket_timeout from 3 seconds to 1 second to detect lost backend
  faster
* Increase pool size from 100 to 1000 connections.

Closes-Bug: 1432242

Change-Id: Ib16a9cba4de8442afa2b78770cb93f561b0fd37e
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit b001daf6c6352b1dac2a7339299ba1fa7d010c1e)

commit_message:
Make DSE hierarchical

Turn DSE into a hierarchical message bus, meaning that each
node on the message bus can either be a standard pub/sub node
or an entire message bus itself.

Change-Id: I2242edfcdf67a007eb50b24fc57b883ff62cc70e

commit_message:
Remove api-paste.ini as it provided by package

Since we have no attribute overrides for api-paste.ini, no
need to have a template resource for it.  Until we need to
have some attribute, removing this will take away burden of
keeping in sync with base openstack code.

Change-Id: I4cb0aec2dc39c9b7f4c8096f24acc28399ae95a8
Closes-Bug: #1433152

subject: Add identity_uri_transform to help move to identity_uri
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-25 22:18:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add identity_uri_transform to help move to identity_uri

Starting on the identity_uri blueprint.  A difference
between the public auth_uri and the admin identity_uri is that
the identity_uri does not include the path/version (/v2.0).
And the auth_uri has to modify the version depending upon
the needs of the environment.
There existed a helper routine called, auth_uri_transform, so
to be consistent and make this easy to follow, I created a
identity_uri_transform which simply removes the path/version
from the uri given.

This helper will then be used thru out the cookbooks to make
the switch to the identity_uri very easy.

I guess the alturnatives are messing with our generic endpoint
definitions/methods, but since they are used for many different
purposes, I think having another matching transform method is the
right way to go here.

Change-Id: I035a4491945c600dea8feb317b357a1a69da28cd
Implements: blueprint identity-uri

commit_message:
Add identity_uri_transform to help move to identity_uri

Starting on the identity_uri blueprint.  A difference
between the public auth_uri and the admin identity_uri is that
the identity_uri does not include the path/version (/v2.0).
And the auth_uri has to modify the version depending upon
the needs of the environment.
There existed a helper routine called, auth_uri_transform, so
to be consistent and make this easy to follow, I created a
identity_uri_transform which simply removes the path/version
from the uri given.

This helper will then be used thru out the cookbooks to make
the switch to the identity_uri very easy.

I guess the alturnatives are messing with our generic endpoint
definitions/methods, but since they are used for many different
purposes, I think having another matching transform method is the
right way to go here.

Bumped version for adding new method which other cookbooks will
depend upon.

Change-Id: I035a4491945c600dea8feb317b357a1a69da28cd
Implements: blueprint identity-uri

commit_message:
Fix for rabbit user issue.

This creates the rabbit user to admin instead of guest. This is
important for multi setups and also to confirm that we don't leverage
the guest user for aio.

Change-Id: I98d5c14badd8e1230a4f13d4d50a6c54556c19af
Closes-Bug: 1434304

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu ml2_conf missing ovs section

Used the existing ovs conf as a partial template to simply include
in the ml2 conf.  This keeps all the attributes the same.
A more detailed spec will have to be done after some refactoring
to allow for sections to be tested.

Please give this idea a try, it seems to allow me to setup neutron
on ubuntu with ml2. I'm working toward using this as a basis for
getting the repo aio_neutron test working.

Change-Id: Ia988f3d7ef1c280c40b55cea4f455710f673dd32
Closes-Bug: #1314751

[{'created': '2015-03-09 14:27:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change default Ceph log file name to '$cluster-$name.log'

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files.

Change-Id: Ief8186006386af8ae7e40cffeeaeef5a5c0f3c70
Closes-Bug: 1428693
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-01 08:01:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change default Ceph log file name to '$cluster-$name.log'

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files.

Note that '$cluster-$name.log' is a default value set by Ceph. In
result, radosgw messages are no longer saved in radosgw.log, but in
ceph-client.admin.log. The best solution is to modify daemon init script
to save this log under different name, but it would require us to
maintain them on our own, what seems no worth the hassle.

Change-Id: Ief8186006386af8ae7e40cffeeaeef5a5c0f3c70
Closes-Bug: 1428693

Closes-Bug: 1428693
", 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Use default log filenames for Ceph OSD nodes

There is a possibility that an OSD host will run many OSD deamons, so it
is better idea to log messages to different files, as it's done by
default.

Change-Id: Ief8186006386af8ae7e40cffeeaeef5a5c0f3c70
Closes-Bug: 1428693

commit_message:
Verify whether interface is already bridge member

Sometimes interface may be automatically added to bridge if config file exists
before interface creation, especially vlan interfaces. It appears on CentOS.

Change-Id: I093a5f7c93d03c413b0a1417776139ba5a707e66
Closes-bug: #1437400

commit_message:
Retry docker builds without cache in build-app/-lp

In case "docker build" fails in the lp-cedarish
build-app and build-lp scripts, just retry with the --no-cache
option. Common function added to contrib/common/utils
for reuse.

Change-Id: Iac3f294c8d3a3b938d4a6a88b4a2679f82c2cb7e

commit_message:
Keep libvirt and device-mapper in sync on rhel

These two packages are inter dependent for how nova uses them, but the
packages are not linked with dependencies.  So, with rhel 7, if the
libvirt package get installed/updated, we should do the same with
the device-mapper to try to keep them in sync.

Change-Id: I0444a8ac4d42093f5b39787e867d9ac70c0e8263
Closes-Bug: #1431387

commit_message:
Resolve the db migration dependency in Neutron

Most of the code of advance services is splited from Neutron,
except create db tables. So there will be errors when execute db
migration of advance services before Neutron. It is a dependency
of db migration.
To avoid erros caused by db dependency, create a recipe to handle
all the db migration for Neutron and advance services. With that
the advance services db migration can be handle after related
tables are created by Neutron db migration.

Change-Id: I502976f34977fae4f2df831382593560a56caa92
Closes-Bug: #1438148

commit_message:
Adds vxlan kernel module to Heat template

Previously, the vxlan kernel module was not being loaded. This
causes the following error when trying to start the lb-agent
when using the vxlan type driver:

ERROR neutron.plugins.linuxbridge.agent.linuxbridge_neutron_agent
[-] Linux kernel vxlan module and iproute2 3.8 or above are
required to enable VXLAN.

Change-Id: I1c9f5d13d25e887d15270a96d35f41a08316c8f0

commit_message:
Add support for aggregates like SUM/COUNT in Datalog

Support for "count" in policy rule, where count
is restricted to be the last in the rule.
error(x,y):- p(x), count(x,y)
Here y holds the count for x in other table.

Set of tests are available with this patch for
verifying count functionality.

Change-Id: I05bf77c8e1e76a36aabce6433ac36422a4fda22e
blueprint: datalog-aggregates

commit_message:
Fix missing translations for log messages

Fixed log translations for error, info and warning messages with
appropriate marker function according to the standards [1].

As LOG.warn has deprecated [2] so I have changed LOG.warn to
LOG.warning.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html
[2] http://bugs.python.org/issue13235

Change-Id: I876c6f3636d511664a25508649e08ad95c40007a
Closes-Bug: 1431256

commit_message:
Fixed issue with waiting for ssh of deleted cluster

If we will delete cluster during waiting for ssh,
check_cluster_exists will be unreachable. 
We should move it up.

Change-Id: I3935269ad7b8a771490f193653d73b17d4b30708
Closes-bug: 1439396

commit_message:
Add functional test for notify.logger

To make sure notify.logger always play well with messaging(v2) driver.
Achieve this by seting up a logger with target logging handler, doing real
logging, finally check notifications that receive from message broker.

Change-Id: I234457974ca48689b9dfc9f7c72b4ea37a57a40b

commit_message:
Modify glance content for Kilo

Modify glance content for Kilo as follows:

1) Change [keystone_authtoken] section to use auth_plugin.

2) Remove log_dir option because Ubuntu init scripts overwrite
   it with command-line options.

3) Add note about differing stock configuration files and usage
   of ellipsis in configuration snippets.

Change-Id: I092a569d56897630fde396286e626a2972df8b80
Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo

commit_message:
Modify neutron content for Kilo

Modify neutron content for Kilo as follows:

1) Change python-keystoneclient to python-openstackclient.

2) Move RabbitMQ configuration to [oslo_messaging_rabbit]
   section.

3) Use "openstack" account for RabbitMQ.

4) Change [keystone_authtoken] and [nova] sections to use
   auth_plugin.

5) Add note about differing stock configuration files and usage
   of ellipsis in configuration snippets.

6) Change database version to 'head' until release.

Implements: blueprint installguide-kilo
Change-Id: I98e76a82cb329680e0c653286c9681fb1a9f67de

commit_message:
[Sahara] fix sahara client calls

The sahara client calls are now using key=value argument passing
everywhere. This allows the arguments to be listed in any order and not
cause errors when a new argument is added.

Change-Id: I3b2304b6c56fb88d280e5b58484bcdb189e04a9d
Closes-Bug: #1439155

subject: minimize the default services
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 11:38:01.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': "minimize the default services

This changes the default service list in devstack to minimize what is
running out of the box, so that it's likelihood of working in a 4G vm
is much higher.

This removes heat from the default enabled service list.

It drops the ec2 only needed n-obj and n-crt services.

It drops all the alternative consoles (xvnc, consoleauth). novnc is
fine for libvirt which is the default.

It adds dstat, because that's turned out to be so useful in debugging
things.

Change-Id: I84457260dff6f42a5c6ebcc2c60fb6e01aec9567
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
minimize the default services

This changes the default service list in devstack to minimize what is
running out of the box, so that it's likelihood of working in a 4G vm
is much higher.

This removes heat from the default enabled service list.

It drops the ec2 only needed n-obj and n-crt services.

It drops all the alternative consoles (xvnc, consoleauth). novnc is
fine for libvirt which is the default.

It adds dstat, because that's turned out to be so useful in debugging
things.

Change-Id: I84457260dff6f42a5c6ebcc2c60fb6e01aec9567

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-02-04 17:50:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't create block device mappings in the API cell

Otherwise 2 block_device_mapping entries will be created
in the API cell:
- the first one (created by the API cell) will have close to
  no information about the volume (device_name and volume_id are NULL)
- the second one (bubbled up from the compute cell) will contain
  all the volume information

The first entry confuses Nova when creating an image since
it won't be able to find the associated volume (NULL) in Cinder.

The compute cell should create it first and propagate it up
to the API cell.

commit_message:
Don't create block device mappings in the API cell

Otherwise 2 block_device_mapping entries will be created
in the API cell:
- the first one (created by the API cell) will have close to
  no information about the volume (device_name and volume_id are NULL)
- the second one (bubbled up from the compute cell) will contain
  all the volume information

The first entry confuses Nova when creating an image since
it won't be able to find the associated volume (NULL) in Cinder.

The compute cell should create it first and propagate it up
to the API cell.

Change-Id: I38edb953e73de6bc70a2e5950c68f457f83303e1
Closes-bug: #1417239
(cherry picked from commit 58633c4f085fc21be1e6439bb3d60d7492358d4a)

commit_message:
Prepare devstack for Ironic cleaning testing

This patch changes the two config options required for Ironic to
successfully test cleaning in devstack.

First, we disable erase_devices clean step. Erase devices in VMs
ends up running shred on the drives for the agent driver, which is
incredibly slow and completely unneeded in devstack.

Additionally, we allow Ironic more time to complete the unprovision
after the nova instance is deleted. This time is spend in the CLEANING
state to clean up the node.

This is related to the Ironic blueprint "implement-cleaning-states".

Change-Id: I77081165a80491da3e66d8a4554b6d71fc3d9353

commit_message:
Allow tenant_id without delegate role if same

The tenant_id query parameter can be specified without the
monitoring delegate role if it matches the tenant_id from the
token used for posting a metric

Posting of a metric to a different tenant_id still requires the
monitoring delegate role

Change-Id: Icdba4c67ecae13d47aa3d6726fe4f9501f4bece6
Closes-bug: #1439392

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-22 04:58:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'DVR qrouters not created on compute Node when vm added

DVR qrouters should be created dynamically on compute
nodes, when VM are created on a routed network.

A recent patch that addressed "Move Post commit ops
out of transaction for bulk" introduced this bug.

It basically changed the order in which the call such
as _get_host_port_if_changed is called. This function
need to be called before the _process_port_binding but
it has been called out of order and so the ml2/plugin
does not call the _notify_l3_agent_new_port.

The current patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I0b2d0e5c3ede6127ffad28dcb7bdc9f66d6f3d97
Closes-Bug: #1411883

commit_message:
DVR qrouters not created on compute Node when vm added

DVR qrouters should be created dynamically on compute
nodes, when VM are created on a routed network.

A recent patch with the change id mentioned below
I9a9683058088e50d9443040223232bf5e1396ccf have
introduced this bug.

It basically changed the order in which the call such
as _get_host_port_if_changed is called. This function
need to be called before the _process_port_binding but
it has been called out of order and so the ml2/plugin
does not call the _notify_l3_agent_new_port.

The current patch addresses this issue.

Change-Id: I0b2d0e5c3ede6127ffad28dcb7bdc9f66d6f3d97
Closes-Bug: #1411883

[{'created': '2015-02-12 13:58:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix ml2 plugin create_port for notify l3 agent

Method _get_host_port_if_changed in create_port
will return None if host_port not changed.

That will make method _notify_l3_agent_new_port
find nothing need notify to l3 agent. And to
DVR case, l3 agent on compute node will get no
notification, so netns qrouter will not be
created or updated.

If host_port not changed, we should use result
we get from method _create_port_db to notify
l3 agent.

The logic is simple, no need to rewrite UT.

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

', 'number': 5}, {'created': '2015-03-20 13:13:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "rm misuse method _get_host_port_if_changed

Method _get_host_port_if_changed should be only
used on updating action, like update_port, not
creating action, like create_port and create_port_bulk.
But current code will invode _get_host_port_if_changed
both in port updating and creating action. This patch
will fix this.

If a port host binding changed, method
_notify_l3_agent_new_port should be invoked with a port
object as parameter. That's the reason why we need
invoke _get_host_port_if_changed(we need compare rpc
parameters with db updated result to judge whether port
host binding changed), and use it return value as
parameter to invoke an l3 agent notification.
To binding changed case, subnet will be fetched from
port, then processing will fetch related routers and
l3-agents to notify. To binding dischanged case, the
port object, notification method received will be None,
and no notification will do.

The method _get_host_port_if_changed accept two
parameters, one is related to db updated result(mech
_context) and the other is received from compute node
rpc(attrs). To port creating action, no previous db
records exist, so host binding in mech_context should
be same with binding in attrs, so method
 _get_host_port_if_changed will return None. But indeed,
we need notify related l3-agents that new port created,
so directly use db updated result, the mech_context
object, to invoke notification method will make sense.

Cloases-Bug: #1411883

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

commit_message:
rm misuse method _get_host_port_if_changed

Method _get_host_port_if_changed should be only
used on updating action, like update_port, not
creating action, like create_port and create_port_bulk.
But current code will invoke _get_host_port_if_changed
both in port updating and creating action. This patch
will fix this.

If a port host binding changed, method
registry_notifier should be invoked with a port
object as parameter. That's the reason why we need
invoke _get_host_port_if_changed(we need compare rpc
parameters with db updated result to judge whether port
host binding changed), and use its return value as
parameter to invoke an l3 agent notification.
For binding changed case, subnet will be fetched from
port, then processing will fetch related routers and
l3-agents to notify. For binding unchanged case, the
port object, notification method received will be None,
and no notification will do.

The method _get_host_port_if_changed accept two
parameters, one is related to db updated result(mech
_context) and the other is received from compute node
rpc(attrs). For port creating action, no previous db
records exist, so host binding in mech_context should
be same with binding in attrs, so method
 _get_host_port_if_changed will return None. But indeed,
we need notify related l3-agents that new port created,
so directly use db updated result, the mech_context
object, to invoke notification method will make sense.

Change-Id: I659c7e1b8a3b0d95657c7edfafff1ca832287b78

[{'created': '2015-04-01 22:33:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'SSP Disk Driver: disconnect_image_disk

Implement disconnect_image_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This removes
the VSCSI mappings for all LUs (of the specified type) from all VIOSes
which are both a) on this host, and b) a member of the Cluster.

The return value is the list of LUs whose mappings were removed.  This
is used as input to the delete_disks method.  We must therefore take
into account that the list of mappings may indicate different sets of
LUs on each VIOS (if, for example, one VIOS was down when a particular
LU was added and mapped).

Verification will fail pending merge of the following from pypowervm:

pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper.remove_lu_mapping
Change-Id: Iab28fe072c949d08edb2d407b1e57a3a9f953173

Implement LU.__hash__
Change-Id: I8b04d8b60a427da6624f818cc4d38f27729b8cc2

commit_message:
SSP Disk Driver: disconnect_image_disk

Implement disconnect_image_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This removes
the VSCSI mappings for all LUs (of the specified type) from all VIOSes
which are both a) on this host, and b) a member of the Cluster.

The return value is the list of LUs whose mappings were removed.  This
is used as input to the delete_disks method.  We must therefore take
into account that the list of mappings may indicate different sets of
LUs on each VIOS (if, for example, one VIOS was down when a particular
LU was added and mapped).

Verification will fail pending merge of the following from pypowervm:

pypowervm.tasks.scsi_mapper.remove_lu_mapping
Change-Id: Iab28fe072c949d08edb2d407b1e57a3a9f953173

Implement LU.__hash__
Change-Id: I8b04d8b60a427da6624f818cc4d38f27729b8cc2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 12:34:59.000000000', 'files': ['stackrc'], 'message': 'Revert "Do not download Fedora cloud image for heat"

The image also used by sahara, changing the condition to
test sahara availability, otherwise devstack fails with:

 ++ openstack --os-url http://<myhost>:9292 image set
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda --property _sahara_tag_0.1=True --property
_sahara_tag_fake=True --property _sahara_username=fedora
ERROR: openstack No image with a name or ID of
'Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda' exists.

This reverts commit 89983b6dfe15e8e83f390e9870cc3ddfbf2b8243.

Change-Id: Ibc96d8d11bc489536825b445a809eabbba4b7813
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Do not download Fedora cloud image for heat"

The image also used by sahara, changing the condition to
test sahara availability, otherwise devstack fails with:

 ++ openstack --os-url http://<myhost>:9292 image set
Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda --property _sahara_tag_0.1=True --property
_sahara_tag_fake=True --property _sahara_username=fedora
ERROR: openstack No image with a name or ID of
'Fedora-x86_64-20-20140618-sda' exists.

This reverts commit 89983b6dfe15e8e83f390e9870cc3ddfbf2b8243.

Change-Id: Ibc96d8d11bc489536825b445a809eabbba4b7813

commit_message:
Remove auto deletion of routers in unit tests

Remove the automatic deletion behavior of the router
context manager in the L3 unit tests. Any tests that
depend on the router being deleted should do so
explicitly.

It additionally removes the logic from the test_l3_plugin
unit tests that was just related to tearing down enough
stuff to allow the context managers to exit. It was code
that distracted from what the tests were actaully verifying.

All of the context managers for port, network, and subnet
do not auto delete by default and that will be extended to
the L3 constructs as well. The patch that did this for
ports/subnets/networks is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/102465/

Change-Id: Iec97198f18e9fc390ff0747b795f7f309c8f3990

commit_message:
VMware: add instance to log messages

A number of log message in vmops.py were not using the instance
as part of the log message. This helps tremendously when debugging.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2b4a2224bf10414f7c3d3981bbf24865b6c457c5

Default templates for Vanilla

[{'created': '2015-03-12 00:12:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add a CLI tool for managing default templates

This change adds a CLI called sahara-templates to manage default
templates. It interfaces to Sahara at the conductor level. The
goal is to allow easy installation of default templates in a
Sahara instance to facilitate cluster launching.

Change-Id: I4f30bd6bc378d90fda41b512c04afe8023d2b4b2

commit_message:
Neutron: simplify validate_networks

Creates a utility method that returns the number of ports required
by an instance. This does the following:
1. it simplifies the method
2. reduce the complexity of the code
'./nova/network/neutronv2/api.py:913:1: C901 'API.validate_networks' is too complex (25)'

NOTE: the code is already tested and this is just moving the internals.

Change-Id: Ibed04a7f10eb85198c7d3ac2cedb58f50ec11f5e

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2014-11-25 18:06:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'VMware: Consume the oslo.vmware objects

oslo.vmware now contains the datastore and datacenter objects.

This patch gets rid of the nova datastore object and leverages
oslo.vmware.
Also, changes the API call to download files in order to be able
to bypass vcenter: the operator can specify whether the downloads
from Glance to the datastores are bypassing vCenter which will
improve the performance of the transfer, reduce the load of
vCenter. This new configuration can to be set to True if there is
network connectivity between Nova compute and the ESX hosts.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I3f1e65dec1500afb58dcb841991ac976887de09d

commit_message:
VMware: Consume the oslo.vmware objects

oslo.vmware now contains the datastore and datacenter objects.

This patch gets rid of the nova datastore object and leverages
oslo.vmware.

Co-authored-by: Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>

Change-Id: I3f1e65dec1500afb58dcb841991ac976887de09d

[{'created': '2014-12-18 10:37:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Corrects list_database query for MySQL

Reasons:
- query used in list_database for MySQL datastore uses a
  hard-coded where clause condition to filter schemas,
  instead of using the values from config variable gnore_dbs.

Changes:
- Removed the hard-coded where condition.
- Used trove.guestagent.db.ValidatedMySQLDatabase
  to filter schemas, which is based on ignore_dbs.
- Updated unit tests to remove the older where clause matching.

Change-Id: I59738e2874e7fd3801e2b0e90cbbb7035e922bd8
Closes-Bug: #1403822

commit_message:
Corrects list_database query for MySQL

Reasons:
- query used in list_database for MySQL datastore uses a
  hard-coded where clause condition to filter schemas,
  instead of using the values from config variable ignore_dbs.

Changes:
- Removed the hard-coded where condition.
- Updated where clause to use the ignore_dbs.
- Updated unit tests to remove the older where clause matching.

Change-Id: I59738e2874e7fd3801e2b0e90cbbb7035e922bd8
Closes-Bug: #1403822

Add event log API section for DataProcessing API

I would be nice to have example of event log api call.
This patch adds this example.

commit_message:
Adding Secret ACL controller layer changes (Part 3)

Added GET/POST/PATCH/DELETE support for SecretACL operations.
Added unit tests for acls controller.

Added creator_id population logic to get userid from token.

Depends-On: I88aaa3ee686a501062bf46974847fc1f3ea844bf

Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

commit_message:
Fix v2.1 list-host to remove 'services' filter

In v2.1, list-host supports 'services' filter also
But this is not case with v2 API. v2 list-host does not support
'services' filter.
v2.1 APIs should be same as v2 in all cases/scenarios.

This is bug fix so not putting as microversions, its just a change to
the v2.1 code so it is equivalent to v2. If later needed then, this can
be reverted back as current ways via microversion.

This was no best test coverage to catch this kind of issue.
This was caught while merging the v2 and v2.1 tests
- Ibd53a7ddd4792942fe2dc45121dcc25fc9864903

Change-Id: I11210babde0c5a668c794cd6aae7eb8c5093a99c
Closes-Bug: #1437184

[{'created': '2015-04-01 11:29:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Catch more general exception in manager's create_volume

When fixing issues with inaccurate allocated_capacity tracking when
create_volume flow fails (Icd6b04ac60c17cbda225d3be8bcc4435ea0cd7a8)
it was ignored that drivers may raise all kinds of exceptions and these
aren't repacked into CinderException in the flow. This commit broadens
except clause to catch Exception when deciding if rescheduling
occurred while creating a volume. Also regression unit test is added.

Change-Id: I36058eacd1eb6b42c6a4311bd3382ddc9f47550c
Closes-Bug: 1438744
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Catch more general exception in manager's create_volume

When fixing issues with inaccurate allocated_capacity tracking when
create_volume flow fails (Icd6b04ac60c17cbda225d3be8bcc4435ea0cd7a8)
it was ignored that drivers may raise all kinds of exceptions and these
aren't repacked into CinderException in the flow. This commit broadens
except clause to catch Exception when deciding if rescheduling
occurred while creating a volume. Also regression unit test is added.

Change-Id: I36058eacd1eb6b42c6a4311bd3382ddc9f47550c
Closes-Bug: 1438744

commit_message:
Fixes in security_groups.

Fixed exception for orphan "vpc-..."-named groups in describe.
Added check for not deleting default VPC group.
Added check for not deleting VPC if non-default groups exist.
Added check for not allowing creation of groups with existing names.

Change-Id: Ia205ff65409577d148c08b40a297d521d8a8acb1

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966
', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-03-17 23:45:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "wip: ec probe test

Tests so far:

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

TODO:
- the 'kill' in the revert case currently requires a hack
in utils.ismount() since SAIO for EC has 2 nodes per
server we can't design the test described above using
'kill server'.  Instead, we rename the node dirs (sdbX)
to force a 507 but this requires two things (a) mount_check
must be true (manual now) and (b) utils.ismount() needs
to know that we're on an SAIO so it can check for
existance of a dir to decide if its 'mounted' or not.  This
will need some discussion!

- there is a race in the revert case if we run all ECrecons
at the same time.  Currently if we do and one of the non
handoff ECrecons runs it can repair the FA before the handoff
Ecrecon runs in which case it will 'want' nothing from the
handoff and currently the revert logic will only delete
files if they reverted with success.  So, something needs
to change there

TODO:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons
- the hack to utils.ismount if agreed upon (well not so
much a hack as a way to enable SAIO to use mount_check)
- getting the mount_check parm when running probe

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966

', 'number': 9}, {'created': '2015-03-20 10:13:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'wip: ec reconstructor probe test

Tests so far:

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

TODO:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons

commit_message:
EC Reconstructor Probe Tests

- BASIC REBUILD: put object, delete part, run ECrecon, get obj
and confirm etag. Do this for part deleted on one node, 2
adjacent nodes, and 2 nodes that are not partners.

- BASIC REVERT:  kill 2 primaries then PUT an obj so we know
handoffs have FAs on them, make sure we can GET.  Kill a
3rd primary so we know a subsequent GET will use them
both.  Restore primaries and run ECrecon on the handoffs
then confirm we can GET the full object and confirm that
the handoffs are totally empty.

- BASIC DELETE REVERT:  test to make sure deletes are
propogated

More ideas:
- more tests!
-- revert with all ECrecons running
-- rebuild when the remote note has newer .data without a
.durable
- deterministic control over races between ECrecons

blueprint ec-reconstructor
Co-Authored-By: paul luse <paul.e.luse@intel.com>
Change-Id: I5eefc96ccabda9ec9d2fd91fdee7b6c55f96e966

Change-Id: I68cfa30c4fcf3bcfb74a7a7614f083b0bd6a40a3

commit_message:
Make sure COPY requests are routed correctly

This change makes sure COPY requests are routed through the correct
controller instance type for the policy. And really all Clay, we
found the issue and wrote a gist.. I'm just throwing it up as a
patch, so it's in the system.

Change-Id: I68cfa30c4fcf3bcfb74a7a7614f083b0bd6a40a3
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

subject: Fix ssync sender behavior for EC reconstructor jobs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7479, 'name': 'paul luse', 'email': 'paul.e.luse@intel.com', 'username': 'peluse'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 19:18:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "WIP: EC specific ssync_sender fixes and tests

Fix some of the EC specific handling in ssync_sender
and add unit tests to cover:

- when deleting sync_revert fragments that have been
sent to receiver, do not delete the durable file.

WIP because there's more to do!

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-31 00:17:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix ssync sender cleanup of reverted fragment files

With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
in place.

Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
to remove an archive file form disk. This encapsulates the EC
specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-03-31 05:31:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix ssync sender cleanup of reverted fragment files

With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
in place.

Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
to remove an archive file form disk. This encapsulates the EC
specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

commit_message:
Fix ssync sender behavior for EC reconstructor jobs

Fixes to ssync with EC:

- With EC ssync may send a specific fragment archive index to
  the receiver (a 'revert') and then remove that fragment archive
  from the sender node. If that fragment archive is the only one
  on the local node then any .durable file for same timestamp
  should also be removed, otherwise the .durable should be left
  in place.

- Adds a purge() method to ECDiskFile which ssync_sender can call
  to remove an archive file from disk. This encapsulates the EC
  specific behavior in the ECDiskFile class.

- Change reconstruct_fa() to raise a DiskFileError if it fails
  to build a diskfile-like-thing.

- ssync continues to make progress if an fragment archive can't
  be built.

- Adds ssync_sender and diskfile unit tests.

- Adds end-to-end ssync test for EC ssync_revert and sync_only
 jobs.

- enable easier upgrades to missing_check protocol phase by
  making sender and receiver parsing of missing check lines
  less brittle. This could prove useful for detecting when
  receiver only needs a .durable file for existing .data file.

Change-Id: Ice42333f1ab21efd8a080195a5a6c7cf08fc272d

commit_message:
No IPv6 SLAAC addrs for create router intf without fixed_ips

Consider the following sequence:
- Create a neutron network
- Create multiple subnets on the network, including one or more IPv6 SLAAC
  subnets
- Create a router port on the network without specifying fixed_ips

The port created in this case is incorrectly getting associated with
addresses from the SLAAC subnet(s). This patch corrects this
behavior.

Change-Id: Ic0ab2294c5487f85baade8f879946dfe738d109b
Closes-Bug: 1432270

commit_message:
Dont create notification with hook data from astute

By convention error message, and error details that are sent
by astute is separated by \n\n.

In case of error message for tasks it is fine, but for notification
its creates a lot of clutter.

Change-Id: I221b6a759d4735ce008e1f2cfeb73c1598b5b089
Closes-Bug: 1432751

commit_message:
Glance cache to not prune newly cached images

Sqlite driver doesn't set the last accessed time when an image is
first added to cache. This makes the newly cached images susceptible
to pruning first instead of older images.

Change-Id: I46973a921c7cfb42811c58383e1b7a4004e70f27
Closes-bug: #1438564

[{'created': '2015-03-24 10:12:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Upload devstack-gate documentation with logs

We need to place the tempest log documentation in with the devstack
logs. We can do this as a publisher shell step.

The tempest overview is a little more complicated as it needs
placing in the top most job results directory. We can scp this for
the old log storage and then for zuul-swift-logs we pass it as a
file to be uploaded which will hence be in the master index (ie at
the top of our pseudo filesystem)

commit_message:
Upload devstack-gate documentation with logs

We need to place the tempest log documentation in with the devstack
logs. We can do this as a publisher shell step.

The tempest overview is a little more complicated as it needs
placing in the top most job results directory. We can scp this for
the old log storage and then for zuul-swift-logs we pass it as a
file to be uploaded which will hence be in the master index (ie at
the top of our pseudo filesystem)

Change-Id: I54d2d2ba9b6532221ca3b376ab2e51bc5398444e
Depends-On: I8b26cc58c2ad6ca029726d227cf1d38d72465627

commit_message:
Adding ACL db repository changes (Part 2)

Added repositories for SecretACL and ContainerACL entities.

There is no repository logic added for ACL user tables as its data
is accessed via relationship defined in respective ACL tables.
Currently ACL logic does not require separate APIs for these entities.

Depends-On: Iffe63e865fd98eb9393a9d87f7921909dc48e4e1

Change-Id: I88aaa3ee686a501062bf46974847fc1f3ea844bf
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

commit_message:
Added csv output format

I have added the csv output format (-f csv). The csv data is written
to bandit_results.csv unless another filename is provided using the
-o flag. csv data does not include any code output, as this cannot
be formatted in a way to be of any use in a spreadsheet.

Change-Id: Ia2f9ee7da08a5a8e610763a528c1e21621e6d28a

Add global limits to V2 limits endpoint

This allows API users to determine the various arbitrary
operator defined limits like max page size, max domain
name length etc

Change-Id: Idb63823f4abbade44cb5bf89334c0056fcabff46

commit_message:
Implement default and max page size for V2 API

Default to 20 items per page, with support for changing the default value, and
support for showing "max" results at once, whichd defaults to 1000 results.

Change-Id: Id358f50a696c848b59b1f339c6e0cb4817dc9c9f
Partial-Bug: 1434479
Closes-Bug: 1439457

commit_message:
Fix cwd path for plugin tasks

For all plugin cwd of the last plugin
in the list was set, the patch uses
plugin specific cwd path.

Change-Id: Ibda17ff02f1dbb9fcf638b2b2696a9c1d83d3100
Closes-bug: #1438649

commit_message:
Remove fuel_update_downloader from the repository

The development started a year ago, since then
there are no updates of plans. The code is not
finished and outdated, hence it's just removing
of unused code.

Change-Id: I385d12f6161a03b43ab820821141f07e6b1365b9
Related-bug: #1434106

against a regex to prevent sending bad names to

commit_message:
Validate plan and lp names in app and lp create

In app create, I've added a check for plan name
against a regex to prevent sending bad names to
Solum and getting a 500 response.

Same story for languagepack names.

Change-Id: I408267ad10fca1faf920c00d093d8f85bfa7a8a2

commit_message:
Adds instructions on custom bootstrap node into dev docs

Since this information is not reflected in
the dev documentation and is requested by different
developers, let's update our current doc with it.
The following topics will be covered:

* how to create an additional
  "piece" of bootstrap (initrd_update)
  that will be injected into the
  original initramfs image on the bootstrap.
  That means, avoid modifying the original initramfs
  image for bootstrap

* how to modify the original initramfs image manually

* hot to create a custom initramfs image for
  bootstrap to replace the default one

Co-Authored-By: Vladimir Kozkukalov <vkozhukalov@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Albert Syriy <asyriy@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6238395e92dc3f0381548c12a15d5619fc5b7411
Closes-Bug: 1428160

[{'created': '2015-03-23 10:31:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IBP: use `archive` in apt pinning instead

Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-23 14:27:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "IBP: fix apt pinning in build script

We need to use 'release a={suite}' instead of

commit_message:
IBP: fix apt pinning in build script

We have to use `archive` name in APT pinning because `suite` is actually
an archive name. For instance, the following upstream Ubuntu repo

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty-updates main

has the following attributes in APT pinning

    a=trusty-updates, n=trusty, c=main

Obviously, it's wrong to use `n=` (codename) for matching suite.

Besides this, since now we're generating a few pinnings for the source
like

    deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/ trusty main restricted

because the following line

    a=trusty, c=main, c=restricted

will apply pinning only for the `restricted` section.

Also, it skips a repo from pinning if its priority isn't set.

Change-Id: Ibe5c99910f70312ea4e4bd0c642cd8f31ddc526b
Implements: blueprint consume-external-ubuntu
Closes-Bug: #1436806

commit_message:
Fix fuel-image

* Use advanced loop device management. It chooses the last available
unused loop device, otherwise it will create a new one with the
higher MINOR number.

* Use random temporary directory to build images.

Combined together, these abilities allow to run simultaneous builds.

Change-Id: Ib9a8ccfbe97fe3f660269526fe9b75cb3d185369
Closes-Bug: #1436423

commit_message:
Add the output from pygmentize

Currently, the tango pygments_style theme is set to tango,
but there was no output from

pygmentize -S tango -f html

Which is required to create the css file.

Tango is does not render nicely, so this patch also switches to the
native theme, which is readable.

Change-Id: Ie69486ba7269d2f4b4adb6d17bb205c2f7cd0161
Closes-bug: #1439523

commit_message:
Improve setting of libvirt rbd secret

Check if the value of the secret key is up to date instead of checking for the existence of the key.
In the current implementation the libvirt key is not updated when the value of the key changes.
This change ensures the key is set to the current value.

Change-Id: Iaccca8797e491e92dd682c521178f9b7e11398ac

commit_message:
Update resource.yaml to reflect recent fixes

Some bugs were fixed in previous commits with how data is presented at /
and /v1/resource but the xfail-ing tests in resource.yaml didn't get
fixed up because they were still failing (instead of becoming unexpected
success) because of the structure of the tests. We'll want to keep this
in mind when creating future xfails.

Change-Id: I7e301d3a97099480edd4ed13709c5865cd8b4929

commit_message:
Adding ACL db model changes (Part 1)

Split db layer changes into two parts (model and repositories).

Moving user ids from ACL tables to respective user tables i.e.
SecretACLUser and ContainerACLUser tables.

Removed soft delete mixin for ACL and ACL user tables. And now
adding unique constraint on these tables.

Adding new ACL and ACL user tables and modified migration scripts.
Added new creator_id support in secret, container and order
entity.

Change-Id: Iffe63e865fd98eb9393a9d87f7921909dc48e4e1
Implements: blueprint add-per-secret-policy

commit_message:
Expose 'is_base' schema property attribute

Changeset I49255255 has added an 'is_base' attribute for Image Schema
properties, thus allowing to differentiate between base and custom image
properties, but the client hasn't make any use of it.

This patch adds appropriate attribute to SchemaProperty class and a
helper method which allows to validate if the given property is base or
not.

The added helper method (is_base_property) should not be confused with
the existing is_core_property: the latter just checks if the property is
known to the schema, regardless of its being base or not.

Change-Id: I7c397196dad9ae5494ed2f8f3aacef3fc1ce70d8
Partial-Bug: #1323660

commit_message:
Introducing docker changes to openstack-compute


This includes cookbook-openstack-compute changes required to enable
nova-docker driver as a compute driver and allow user to configure a
compute as docker compute

Implements: blueprint docker-driver-configuration

Change-Id: I6fa7e93a4050419fb0531e17b56da4c32205bce3

commit_message:
Fuel plugin install --force now can install new plugin

Without this changes fuel return error if you will
try to install new plugin using install with --force

Change-Id: Id3b2966f78bf24bb47f05b7d0a02bb101b7843b5
Closes-Bug: #1439128

subject: Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-02 12:18:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

merged from Ifb5cb05b9cc2b8758d5a8e34f7792470a73d7c40

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Nova dropped python 2.6 support, we can leverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798/

commit_message:
Performance: leverage dict comprehension in PEP-0274

merged from Ifb5cb05b9cc2b8758d5a8e34f7792470a73d7c40

PEP-0274 introduced dict comprehensions to replace dict constructor
with a sequence of length-2 sequences, these are benefits copied
from [1]:
  The dictionary constructor approach has two distinct disadvantages
  from the proposed syntax though.  First, it isn't as legible as a
  dict comprehension.  Second, it forces the programmer to create an
  in-core list object first, which could be expensive.
Nova dropped python 2.6 support, we can leverage this now.
There is deep dive about PEP-0274[2] and basic tests about
performance[3].
Note: This commit doesn't handle dict constructor with kwagrs.
This commit also adds a hacking rule.

[1]http://legacy.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0274/
[2]http://doughellmann.com/2012/11/12/the-performance-impact-of-using-dict-instead-of-in-cpython-2-7-2.html
[3]http://paste.openstack.org/show/154798/

Change-Id: I1bc53e335b6c291da5c54f067f9fdfd5da6b2902

commit_message:
remove stale pyc before tests

Stale pyc files can create massive confusion on failing
tests. Extremely hard to debug. Remove all pyc files before we run
tests.

Change-Id: I67da587382af87389c2d04c23d84f13f341a1e46
Related-Bug: #1401600

commit_message:
Security tests for Container resources

These tests will attempt CRUD operations on Container resources, both
with and without (dummy) project ids, and always without valid tokens.
They should all return HTTP 401s. Fixed block comment formatting for
PEP8. Added tests to ContainersUnauthedTestCase class, tagged with
security and negative attributes.

Change-Id: I2952f06f8e9141028a606a587e07a07b5d9358c2

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't output file content in log

when the number of ports in a network is large, outputing the file
content in log is expensive.

Change-Id: Ia634792064ee9832f20cd79d22c1b6b9483d2cac

commit_message:
Poll on the actual image showing up

Turns out just polling on the task completion doesn't mean you actually
have the image. You also need to poll on the image becoming a thing in
glance.

Change-Id: I910ac612e6af1f5888c1820a09ee79fab012bdae

Add delete_image call

Lo and behold! Deleting images works differently between glance v1 and
v2. Of course it does.

Change-Id: I9eb97950507d95076342ef3cb56205ff505f7fae

nbctl current implementation doesnt support transactions and
the current implementation mislead regarding that.

commit_message:
Replace python webserver with apache in container

Apache can serve repo requests better than the simple
HTTP server, plus docker can dynamically allocate a random
host port far more effectively than randomly selecting one.

This patch offers better stability when building Fuel.

Change-Id: I83efa2b5100663b3de117e15c0eea47288842953
Closes-Bug: #1421610

commit_message:
Skip passing in timeout to glance if it's not set

glanceclient wants to do a float type validation, which is laudable.
However, it means we can't pass in timeout=None, and instead have to
avoid passing in the parameter if we do not have it set.

Change-Id: Ie6e144d6e3cedf5bf8846beefcfda0f3252377e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-23 13:26:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/policy_fixture.py'], 'message': 'Avoid load real policy from policy.d when using fake policy fixture

The v2.1 API policy rules separated into a file in policy.d. But the
fake policy fixture didn't override the default policy_dirs config,
that leads to fake policy fixture will load real policy config from
"/etc/nova/policy.d" and unittest will failed.

This patch override default policy_dirs value to empty list.

Change-Id: I7d8958dc2f0bb927b98b2bb86c99e855db6c5e2e
Closes-Bug: #1435327
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid load real policy from policy.d when using fake policy fixture

The v2.1 API policy rules separated into a file in policy.d. But the
fake policy fixture didn't override the default policy_dirs config,
that leads to fake policy fixture will load real policy config from
"/etc/nova/policy.d" and unittest will failed.

This patch override default policy_dirs value to empty list.

Change-Id: I7d8958dc2f0bb927b98b2bb86c99e855db6c5e2e
Closes-Bug: #1435327

commit_message:
Reload drivers when their domain config is updated

When a domain config is modifed, in order for those configs
to actually be live, we need to re-initialise the backend
identity driver for the respective domain.

This patch uses cache timeouts to ensure that new config options
become visible to all keystone processes/threads.

Partially Implements: blueprint domain-config-ext
Change-Id: I1a802dde53f25f945eadd235574e9c342a770443

commit_message:
Fix PciDeviceDBApiTestCase with referential constraint checking

PciDeviceDBApiTestCase relies on being able to create database rows
without referential constraint checking, which is the default on
sqlite but not other backends. This change adds the required compute
node row when creating pci device rows.

Change-Id: I5c31f75d612946237a939acd86c143d895580fda

The policy.d infrastructure was not previously tested anywhere real,

files. Using policy.d means that nova-api makes > 33k reparses of the

file.

commit_message:
remove usage of policy.d which isn't cached

This is a partial revert of Id8e1e84cd3717dfd0a3b3f80acec50f96c205251

The policy.d infrastructure was not previously tested anywhere real,
and turns out that it completely invalidates the caching of policy
files. Using policy.d means that nova-api makes > 33k reparses of the
policy files during a gate run.

There is no straight forward fix at this point in the cycle given
various library freezes in oslo. Instead we should revert using the
policy.d directory and merge those rules back into the policy.json
file.

Change-Id: I588c46819728e839f9e6c03ac3d673646d76b7ff
Closes-Bug: #1438861

Add missed links in DataProcessing API docs

Links for following types of API calls are missed:
 * image registry
 * plugins
 * jobs
 * jobs exec
 * job types

We should take this links back.

Closes-Bug: 1414852

commit_message:
Process batched messages in Python API correctly

Python API now has a reference issue that only logs the last
of a batch of incoming messages, as many times as there are
messages in the batch.

Change-Id: I50daf0b2281ff49e03c58e7c91a998d403ea2f7c
Closes-Bug: 1414852

commit_message:
Fix pep8 issues and add apache header to subunit2html

This commit fixes pep8 issues that were added when subunit2html was
copied into the repo. As part of this the subunit2html was missing a
license header for the additions made to it on top of the original
HTMLTestRunner script it was based on. The addition of the copyright
header mirrors project-config change:
I6fc16d316012fd3e1c196f74df25d725a310f6dc

Change-Id: Ieb42d5baddb3e1446fcd50197136f605324323aa

commit_message:
Update docs and security-docs teams

For docs:
Add openstackdocstheme as new repository, remove recently removed folks
from core-team list. Fix typos in Summer's and Shilla's login.
Add three new core members.

For security-docs:
Add Nathaniel Dillon (sicarie)

Change-Id: I90609adbb32cf1e6a86e0ea83483ef6f9b464466

commit_message:
Add in common configuration file

Provide a common configuration file that will have all of the OVN

subject: Document installation from repository
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 12:42:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Document installation from repository

The reviewstats library cannot be installed from PyPI as it is, as
a tag is needed, or at least a package download URL must be
specified. A user can still install the library and the utilities
by cloning the repo and running the setup script, and therefore
this process is documented rather than the erroneous pip command.

Change-Id: I342fa0f68242316e7ef7bb5959118fdd32d10b9e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-02 13:41:09.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'Document installation from repository

The reviewstats library cannot be installed from PyPI as it is, as
a tag is needed, or at least a package download URL must be
specified. A user can still install the library and the utilities
by cloning the repo and running the setup script, and therefore
this process is documented rather than the erroneous pip command.

Change-Id: I342fa0f68242316e7ef7bb5959118fdd32d10b9e
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Document installation from repository

The reviewstats library cannot be installed from PyPI as it is, as
a tag is needed, or at least a package download URL must be
specified. A user can still install the library and the utilities
by cloning the repo and running the setup script, and therefore
this process is documented rather than the erroneous pip command.

Change-Id: I342fa0f68242316e7ef7bb5959118fdd32d10b9e

commit_message:
Json exporters for stats added

For system tests purposes http handlers for fetching stats
added into analytics.
Implemented OSWLs exporters:
- /api/v1/json/oswls/<master_node_uid>,
- /api/v1/json/oswls/<master_node_uid>/<resource_type>
Implemented installation info exporter:
- /api/v1/json/installation_info/<master_node_uid>

Change-Id: I4b049bb8b955ca98dab18ddcd9f96f9965bb9902
Closes-Bug: #1438228

", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-03-27 17:16:00.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check_uuid.py'], 'message': "Clarify how to resolve a uuid collision

commit_message:
Clarify how to resolve a uuid collision

Previously 'tox -epep8' just says run 'tox -v -euuidgen' but without
manually removing the duplicate uuid it fails to fix things and says run
'tox -v -euuidgen' again.

Change-Id: I1948c2d038d89af8dcfe69d01dcc49d024ae3210

commit_message:
Simplify `wait_for` calls

Rely on the the `check_for_*` functions and remove redundant
`fail_unless_*` calls.

Also change `wait_for` to exit when it is missing a required argument.

Change-Id: I90c4545691d53185556e2838303ac3df0afaf9fa

commit_message:
Replace SQL code for ORM analog in DB migration scripts

Replace explicit usage of SQL code with appropriate analog of ORM.
It allows to keep abstraction between DB and python clear without
potential incompatibilities due to differencies in SQL dialects.

Change-Id: Ied97264cafcec0bcebd4c3ddc7b29185825c56a6
Closes-Bug: #1437278

commit_message:
convert CMD output to array before comparing

Some times patchcords was added bebore bond interface. In thos case full-text search may give
wrong positive answer. (substring 'bond0' found inside 'br-bond0').

Change-Id: Ie54d94ce83906a972b422c5a5bb048d61f26db7f
Closes-bug: #1375347
(cherry picked from commit 6716a3ece8fb9cba2874039189a325a41c6086b2)

commit_message:
Migrate API calls to task management

Now that we have a task management framework, make sure all of the API
calls we make go through it. The net effect on people not taking
advantage of the feature should be zero, but should allow for porting of
nodepool to shade.

Change-Id: I0f2cf912f45e76c9f5194e3b8813278b883b4adc

Change-Id: I0960bf155654444b044b1b11aa49d252d5f212c5

commit_message:
Keep history of updated resource attributes

This change keeps history of updated resource attributes
by creating a new row in resource_history tables each times the
resource table is updated.

Each resource extention table also gain a '<resource_name>_history' to
track their history too.

Change-Id: I0960bf155654444b044b1b11aa49d252d5f212c5

commit_message:
ClippyJS: Make help more awesome.

In this age of virtual assistants (e.g., Siri, Cortana) Horizon
should have one that people recognize to help them. This
introduces Clippy to Horizon to be used as a virtual assistant
and helper. This is the foundation which can be built upon.
For more information see https://www.smore.com/clippy-js

Change-Id: I63e56e50f1362e59324be7c9bd7f9fd2d925e523

subject: Use libreswan on fedora
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-29 04:06:13.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/params.pp'], 'message': 'Use libreswan on fedora

Without this patch, Fedora systems will always try to install openswan
instead of libreswan. This is a problem on Fedora 20 and 21 which do
not have openswan available. Fedora 19 has both packages available, so
this patch changes the params.pp to install libreswan if the
operatingsystem fact is Fedora.

Change-Id: I6043dbda057ad254bd706b2d8c4d0b2ce0ffef5e
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use libreswan on fedora

Without this patch, Fedora systems will always try to install openswan
instead of libreswan. This is a problem on Fedora 20 and 21 which do
not have openswan available. Fedora 19 has both packages available, so
this patch changes the params.pp to install libreswan if the
operatingsystem fact is Fedora.

Change-Id: I6043dbda057ad254bd706b2d8c4d0b2ce0ffef5e

  puppetlabs_spec_helper)

commit_message:
spec: updates for rspec-puppet 2.x and rspec 3.x

This patch aim to update our specs test in order to work with the rspec-puppet
release 2.0.0, in the mean time, we update rspec syntax order to be prepared
for rspec 3.x move.

In details:
* Upgrade and pin rspec-puppet from 1.0.1 to 2.0.0
* Convert 'should' keyword to 'is_expected.to' (prepare rspec 3.x)
* Fix spec tests for rspec-puppet 2.0.0
* Clean Gemfile (remove over-specificication of runtime deps of
  puppetlabs_spec_helper)

Change-Id: Ice356e35a65204a62e47f49dd4f5816208a6dace
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Create swift container if it does not exist

In the glance v2 image upload workflow, the user is not doing things
with swift containers, swift containers are being created by shade. This
means that it's shade's responsibility to ensure that the container
exists before it attempts to upload something to it.

Change-Id: I34cfc2821819aec105947dbe70a578307e583d77

commit_message:
Report status of boot loader installation to Ironic

This commit changes the 80-deploy-ironic script of
deploy-ironic element to report back the status of
boot loader install (when boot_option == "local")
using a newly introduced vendorpassthru.

Closes-Bug: 1422723

subject: Add task management framework
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-29 04:59:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add task management framework

Some shade clients, like nodepool, have a need to manage threads that
are doing API tasks and to manage rate limiting. That's not really a
thing that's appropriate for shade to know about, but because shade does
want to know the business logic, we need to provide a mechanism for
people to do that.

TaskManager is essentially nodepool.TaskManager except with
threading features removed and reworked to do instantaneous blocking
execution, since that's the behavior that most users will expect.

A patch will follow to move API calls to be manged by Tasks and the
shade.TaskManager. Once those are there, then nodepool can pass in its
TaskManager and the API operations in shade will naturally be managed by
the rate-limited operations in nodepool.

Change-Id: I60d25271de4009ee3f7f7684c72299fbd5d0f54f

commit_message:
Add task management framework

Some shade clients, like nodepool, have a need to manage threads that
are doing API tasks and to manage rate limiting. That's not really a
thing that's appropriate for shade to know about, but because shade does
want to know the business logic, we need to provide a mechanism for
people to do that.

TaskManager is essentially nodepool.TaskManager except with
threading features removed and reworked to do instantaneous blocking
execution, since that's the behavior that most users will expect.

A patch will follow to move API calls to be manged by Tasks and the
shade.TaskManager. Once those are there, then nodepool can pass in its
TaskManager and the API operations in shade will naturally be managed by
the rate-limited operations in nodepool.

Co-Authored-By: James E. Blair <jeblair@openstack.org>
Change-Id: I60d25271de4009ee3f7f7684c72299fbd5d0f54f

commit_message:
Namespace caching per cloud

In places where we have multiple clouds, such as nodepool, if we want
to use shared or persistent caching, we need to include cloud name in
the cache so that we don't try to return rackspace flavors to hp clouds.

Change-Id: I65a7b1bf6818f6b40b42bd2fa4b560f127c5589b

commit_message:
Add initial scenario test for Manila

Adapt manager and add first initial test for Manila. A ping check will
be performed to check the connectivity from the VM to the share
server/service. The test can be triggered using the experimental test
job introduced by [1].

Open todo's that can be addressed later:
 - Support of flat network
 - More flexible configuration options

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/164102/

Change-Id: Ie72e877a88c337866e9cb591f8099218d84ee5dd
Partially-implements: blueprint scenario-tests

commit_message:
Allow for passing cache class in as a parameter

It's possible you'd want to set the cache class either as a programmatic
parameter to the constructor, or in the clouds.yaml config file.
Facilitate both.

Depends-On: I6c9eab71a88a534de7e52ad2a564450c44aacc1d
Change-Id: I9575eae869881bf6784d2d867f2f571ddbab7769

commit_message:
SSP Disk Driver: connect_disk

Implement connect_disk in the SSP disk driver.  This creates a VSCSI
mapping to the LPAR's LU on each VIOS which is both a) on this host, and
b) a member of the Cluster.

Change-Id: Ie1cc4cf38c05cca596a9c65feaf05970e20dd8ee

commit_message:
Move orphaned api test - deux

According to changes [1,2], API tests' new home is under neutron/tests/api.
Change 92d2054f8a slipped through the cracks. It seems also that wrong
imports lead to tests silently dropped (i.e. not executed). This patch
rectifies the issue.

 [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169850/
 [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/167320/

Change-Id: I64be376d7cff9512bd027720116dc039831e7955

commit_message:
Don't add exception instance in LOG.exception

LOG.exception will print out the full stacktrace, that's enough.
We should only record meaningful message.

merged from I8b5c581717e6b78c11c46e226463927450c9f287

Change-Id: I49865d558ff5feda2d6a803741fbee18064b2aec

Use the builtin versioncmp() function for comparisons of the
'::operatingsystemmajrelease' fact. If that fact evaluates to a string,
regular arithmetric comparisons will fail under the Puppet 4.x
language.

Change-Id: Ic66516a5548be0fe6f6fb818d04086cf234f2fc1
Closes-bug: 1425300
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use versioncmp for '::operatingsystemmajrelease' comparison

Use the builtin versioncmp() function for comparisons of the
'::operatingsystemmajrelease' fact. If that fact evaluates to a string,
regular arithmetric comparisons will fail under the Puppet 4.x
language.

Change-Id: Ic66516a5548be0fe6f6fb818d04086cf234f2fc1
Closes-bug: 1425300
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tag all Ceilometer packages

Some users wish to override the default package provider by their own.

Tag all packages with the 'openstack' to allow mass resource attributes
override using resource collectors.

Closes-bug: #1391209

Change-Id: If43101b9974d26c88f8612da64c5356a644f892e
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Install packaged pyOpenSSL
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-27 04:02:16.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms/general'], 'message': "Install packaged pyOpenSSL

pyOpenSSL has done a rewrite of itself in Python.  This may be good
for many reasons, but memory usage is not one of them.  It just about
doubles the size of at least swift, which usually consumes about 6% of
a CI testing vm's 8gb RAM.  This is enough to push centos hosts into
OOM conditions and then everything falls apart.

The distro packages of pyOpenSSL are the older C-based versions, which
doesn't bring in the kitchen sink of cffi & pycparser.

Change-Id: Icd4100da1d5cbdb82017da046b00b9397813c2f2
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Install packaged pyOpenSSL

pyOpenSSL has done a rewrite of itself in Python.  This may be good
for many reasons, but memory usage is not one of them.  It just about
doubles the size of at least swift, which usually consumes about 6% of
a CI testing vm's 8gb RAM.  This is enough to push centos hosts into
OOM conditions and then everything falls apart.

The distro packages of pyOpenSSL are the older C-based versions, which
doesn't bring in the kitchen sink of cffi & pycparser.

Change-Id: Icd4100da1d5cbdb82017da046b00b9397813c2f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-05 00:18:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow metadata proxy to log with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot be runned with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as others services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to choose between 3 logging modes for metadata proxy
(using metadata_proxy_log_mode option):
* legacy: as currently inherits logging config from agent one (default),
* unwatch: similar to legacy except that WatchedFileHandlerhandlers are
  replaced by FileHandler which implies to use copytruncate option in
  logrotate if logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy logging files,
* syslog: metadata proxy uses only syslog (even the agent logs to a
  file).

It allows to change how metadata proxy logs without changing how the
agent logs. Unwatched and syslog modes support permissions drop as r/w
permissions are required to open the file/socket only during startup.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

  replaced by FileHandler which implies to use copytruncate option in
  logrotate if logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy logging files,
* syslog: metadata proxy uses only syslog (even the agent logs to a
  file).

It allows to change how metadata proxy logs without changing how the
agent logs. Unwatched and syslog modes support permissions drop as r/w
permissions are required to open the file/socket only during startup.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

commit_message:
Allow metadata proxy to log with nobody user/group

Currently metadata proxy cannot run with nobody user/group as
metadata proxy (as other services) uses WatchedFileHandler handler to
log to file which does not support permissions drop (the process must
be able to r/w after permissions drop to "watch" the file).

This change allows to enable/disable log watch in metadata proxies with
the new option metadata_proxy_log_watch. It should be disabled when
metadata_proxy_user/group is not allowed to read/write metadata proxy
log files. Option default value is deduced from metadata_proxy_user:

* True if metadata_proxy_user is agent effective user id/name,
* False otherwise.

When log watch is disabled and logrotate is enabled on metadata proxy
logging files, 'copytruncate' logrotate option must be used otherwise
metadata proxy logs will be lost after the first log rotation.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I40a7bd82a2c60d9198312fdb52e3010c60db3511
Partial-Bug: #1427228

commit_message:
Script that profiles imports

If you run Rally with this code it will profile all imports
that occured during the run of Rally and store them to

imports_full_info.json and as well store 100 longest in file
imports_100_longest.txt

Change-Id: I3e4eff1b7895f28fc9495ff11dcb7dc343380407

Fix warnings about wrong usage of :option: that more recent Sphinx
versions emit:

marker - or -- or / or +

commit_message:
Sort the panel's variable in the dashboards.py

In the dashboards.py some PanelGroup's variable
use(slug,name.panels), and some use(name, slug, panels),
we can unit it, used as(slug,name.panels).

Change-Id: If508fcb59c372c581938152db8bceb4ed849c256
Closes-bug:#1438984

commit_message:
Fix problem with deploy cinder-vmware role

The role cinder is "upstream" for the role cinder-vmware
which depend on it. Cinder was changed and cinder-vmware
should be changed after that.

Change-Id: I97c9d32d93fc3bb47a655be5a1cec69216b55f8f
Closes-bug: 1433201

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-27 16:38:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove use of len for testing truth

In Python a sequence or mapping that is empty has a truth value of
False, otherwise they are True. This means that:

for empty mappings and sequences
    if len(var1) == 0:
can be written as
    if not var1:

and for mappings and sequences with values:
    if len(var1) != 0
can be written as
    if var1:

This commit removes the use of len in this way. This makes the code
more 'pythonic' and improves readability and consistency.

A hacking check forms part of this commit to prevent regression. If for
some reason the len test is required the line can be marked as noqa to
so that line is skipped for that test.

Change-Id: I8978d8f5d815fdc711f26a14b5d227dc5d28618e

commit_message:
Remove use of len for testing truth

In Python a sequence or mapping that is empty has a truth value of
False, otherwise they are True. This means that:

for empty mappings and sequences
    if len(var1) == 0:
can be written as
    if not var1:

and for mappings and sequences with values:
    if len(var1) != 0
can be written as
    if var1:

This commit removes the use of len in this way. This makes the code
more 'pythonic' and improves readability and consistency.

A hacking check forms part of this commit to prevent regression. If for
some reason the len test is required the line can be marked as noqa to
so that line is skipped for that test.

Change-Id: I8978d8f5d815fdc711f26a14b5d227dc5d28618e

commit_message:
remove enable-cinder checkobox

There is "Enable Cinder" checkbox on the VMware tab in Fuel UI. It mean
that this vCenter should be used as backend for cinder-vmware. But in
Fuel 6.1 only one vCenter accessed and special checkbox totally useless

Therefore I offer very simple logik: if you want have cinder with vmdk
backend, assign cinder-vmware role to any node. Do nothing in opposite
case.

Change-Id: I35d01f892a28075cdd37ac684d68cfc89b40a41e
Implements: blueprint cinder-vmdk-role
Closes-bug: 1435725

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12081, 'name': 'IBM xCAT CI', 'email': 'xcat@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-xcat-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12356, 'name': 'Vladyslav Drok', 'email': 'vdrok@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vdrok'}, {'_account_id': 14760, 'name': 'John L. Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-03-30 23:00:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Top level unit tests: Use autospec=True for mocks

For the mocks use autospec=True.  This will help to catch errors when
using incorrect assertion tests.

Fix errors in tests that were discovered by changing to using
autospec=True

Use iter() around lists in side_effects as Mock has a bug when using
autospec=True.

Change-Id: Ie95aab4a007d6cae4590178b4eb99a1baf7ca0e7

commit_message:
Top level unit tests: Use autospec=True for mocks

For the mocks use autospec=True.  This will help to catch errors when
using incorrect assertion tests.

Fix errors in tests that were discovered by changing to using
autospec=True

Use iter() around lists in side_effects as Mock has a bug when using
autospec=True.  The Python 3.x bug: http://bugs.python.org/issue17826

Change-Id: Ie95aab4a007d6cae4590178b4eb99a1baf7ca0e7

commit_message:
Add authenticate method in sdk module

This method will do authentication based on user credential provided.
If succeed, a valid token_id will be return, otherwise, an exception
will be raised.

Change-Id: I0541433604ffae29b2f25d8aa7107c51a340423b

Handle error message from task that failed on master

Some pre/post deployment hooks can be executed on master
node, therefore we need correctly handle response

subject: Fix intermittent unit test failures
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-01 20:36:11.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'message': 'Fix intermittent unit test failures

The following tests have been failing recently:

 test_update_add_locations_status_exception
 test_update_replace_duplicate_locations
 test_update_replace_locations_status_exception

They were querying storeurl.com which redirected to
www.hugedomains.com, and unexpected exchanges, eg:

 HTTP/1.1 302 Found.
 Cache-Control: private.
 Content-Length: 183.
 Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8.
 Date: Wed, 01 Apr 2015 19:05:15 GMT.
 Location: http://www.hugedomains.com/domain_profile.cfm?d=storeurl&e=com.
 Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.0.
 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET.
 Connection: keep-alive.

Mocking out the get_size function prevents these real connections.

Change-Id: Ia5d867f98ac60479c70362b0477c2a0571ac6e4f
Closes-bug: 1437346
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix intermittent unit test failures

The following tests have been failing recently:

 test_update_add_locations_status_exception
 test_update_replace_duplicate_locations
 test_update_replace_locations_status_exception

They were querying storeurl.com which redirected to
www.hugedomains.com, and unexpected exchanges, eg:

 HTTP/1.1 302 Found.
 Cache-Control: private.
 Content-Length: 183.
 Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8.
 Date: Wed, 01 Apr 2015 19:05:15 GMT.
 Location: http://www.hugedomains.com/domain_profile.cfm?d=storeurl&e=com.
 Server: Microsoft-IIS/8.0.
 X-Powered-By: ASP.NET.
 Connection: keep-alive.

Mocking out the get_size function prevents these real connections.

Change-Id: Ia5d867f98ac60479c70362b0477c2a0571ac6e4f
Closes-bug: 1437346

commit_message:
Define get_cidr helper function

The pattern "'%s/%s' % (ip, prefixlen)" is used in multiple places to
compute an ip cidr from an ip and a prefixlen. This change defines the
get_cidr function to avoid such code duplication.

Change-Id: I2d2824e32008f634012fd8bf38e104948f174d95
